en.label: Traditional Fantasy Calendar (Epoch-based)
en.description: A classic fantasy calendar that starts from year 1 and advances time from the beginning of the age. Perfect for traditional fantasy campaigns where worldTime=0 means the dawn of the current era.

months.name: Dawn-moon
months.description: The first month of spring, when dawn breaks longest and nature awakens.

months.name: Green-moon
months.description: The second month of spring, when all the world turns green with new life.

months.name: Flower-moon
months.description: The third month of spring, when flowers bloom across meadow and forest.

months.name: Sun-moon
months.description: The first month of summer, when the sun's power waxes strong.

months.name: Fire-moon
months.description: The second month of summer, when heat blazes across the land.

months.name: Thunder-moon
months.description: The third month of summer, when storms rage and thunder rolls.

months.name: Harvest-moon
months.description: The first month of autumn, when crops are gathered and stored.

months.name: Wine-moon
months.description: The second month of autumn, when grapes are pressed and ale is brewed.

months.name: Dying-moon
months.description: The third month of autumn, when leaves fall and nature prepares for winter.

months.name: Frost-moon
months.description: The first month of winter, when frost covers the land each morning.

months.name: Snow-moon
months.description: The second month of winter, when snow blankets the world in white.

months.name: Dark-moon
months.description: The third month of winter, the shortest and darkest time of the year.

weekdays.name: Godsday
weekdays.description: First day of the week, dedicated to the gods and spiritual matters

weekdays.name: Kingsday
weekdays.description: Second day, for royal decrees and matters of governance

weekdays.name: Workday
weekdays.description: Third day, the primary day for labor and craftsmanship

weekdays.name: Marketday
weekdays.description: Fourth day, when merchants gather and trade flourishes

weekdays.name: Warday
weekdays.description: Fifth day, traditionally for training and military exercises

weekdays.name: Restday
weekdays.description: Sixth day, for rest, family time, and personal pursuits

weekdays.name: Moonday
weekdays.description: Seventh day, sacred to lunar deities and magic

intercalary.name: Spring Awakening
intercalary.description: A festival day celebrating the return of life to the world

intercalary.name: Summer Solstice
intercalary.description: The longest day of the year, when the sun's power peaks

intercalary.name: Autumn Gathering
intercalary.description: A harvest festival when communities come together

intercalary.name: Winter's Heart
intercalary.description: The deepest night of winter, when folk kindle fires against the dark
